text:
In Opinion

"In the best of times, life in New York City can be unforgiving," writes Yunghi Kim. "The pandemic is hitting low-income families and people of color — who often work in critical service jobs — the hardest." https://t.co/dlm9JyJj8c

name: nytimes
text: “Our hearts are burning.” Hasankeyf in Turkey is an archeological gem, a valley thought to have been inhabited since Neolithic times. Thousands of families lived there until this year — when the country's president flooded it for economic development. https://t.co/AwAdgOgAz4

text: Shaggy’s latest album, “Hot Shot 2020,” is out July 10. He puts roasted yam, street dancing and yacht parties in Jamaica on his list of must-haves. https://t.co/6sLLdacrnH

text: A Brooklyn winemaker travels north to Bristol Bay each summer to net the red salmon that support his family. This year he’s faced with a tough ethical and economic choice. https://t.co/mQXMwQDWsY

Breaking News: Nick Cordero, known for his tough-guy roles on Broadway, has died at 41. He had been hospitalized for three months after contracting the coronavirus.

text: President Trump claimed that 99% of U.S. coronavirus infections are “totally harmless." This is false. No matter how you define harmless, most public health experts and respected coronavirus disease models would flatly contradict his assessment. https://t.co/lywkEwvG7z
